sen.j: 内談衆（ないだんしゅう）とは、室町幕府の引付方あるいは内談方において所務沙汰の審議にあたった構成員。
sen.e: Naidanshu was in charge of judging shomusata (trial dealing with land-related issues) in hikitsukekata or naidankata (office of adjudication) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 引付方「Hikitsuke-kata (office of adjudicants)」を「hikitsukekata (office of adjudication)」に変更しました。
sen.e: Naidanshu was in charge of judging shomusata (trial dealing with land-related issues) in hikitsukekata or naidankata (office of adjudication) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Naidanshu were in charge of judging trials dealing with land-related issues in hikitsukekata or naidankata (both are offices of adjudication) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府に置かれた引付衆の後身的存在であるため、引付衆（ひきつけしゅう）とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: It was also called the hikitsukeshu as it was a reconstituted system of hikitsukeshu set up by the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
It was also called the hikitsukeshu as it was a reconstituted system of hikitsukeshu set up by the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It was also called the hikitsukeshu as it was a successor to the system of hikitsukeshu set up by the Kamakura bakufu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 内談（ないだん）とは、室町幕府の諸機関それぞれで行われていた部局内の会議のことであった。
sen.e: Naidan originally meant meetings in the departments held respectively in the organizations of the Muromachi bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Naidan originally meant meetings in the departments held respectively in the organizations of the Muromachi bakufu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Naidan originally meant meetings in the departments held within the various sections of the Muromachi bakufu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 足利直義が引付衆を再編して所領問題を扱う専門部局して内談方を置いて以後、内談方の構成員を指すようになり、更に直義の失脚で引付方が復活した後も継承された。
sen.e: After Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA reorganized the hikitsukeshu to set up in departments naidankata which exclusively handled problems of territories, naidan came to refer to a member of the naidankata, which was succeeded even after Tadayoshi lost his position and then the hikitsukekata wa restored.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA reorganized the hikitsukeshu to set up naidankata in departments which exclusively handled territorial problems, naidan came to refer to a member of the naidankata, which was succeeded even after Tadayoshi lost his position and the hikitsukekata were then restored.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: After Tadayoshi ASHIKAGA reorganized the hikitsukeshu to set up naidankata(judges) in departments which exclusively handled territorial problems, naidan came to refer to a member of the naidankata, which was continued even after Tadayoshi lost his position and the hikitsukekata were restored.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: また、再審・指揮監督を目的として仁政方・庭中方が合わせて設置された。
sen.e: Additionally, Jinseigata and Niwanakagata were also set up for the purpose of retrial, instruction and supervision.
Additionally, Jinseigata and Niwanakagata were also set up for the purpose of retrial, instruction and supervision.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Additionally, Jinseigata (a court in Muromachi bakufu) and Teichugata (office of direct petition) were also set up for the purpose of retrial, instruction and supervision.
sen.cmt: 仁政方→Jinseigata→Jinseigata (a court in Muromachi bakufu)庭中方→Niwanakagata→Teichugata (office of direct petition) [http://wwwsoc.nii.ac.jp/rekiken/english/journal/2006e.html]

sen.j: 内談衆は担当地域ごとに3番（内談方）あるいは5番（引付方）に分けられて、足利氏一門や守護大名を代表である頭人のもとに約10-20名が任命された。
sen.e: Naidanshu were divided into No. 3 (naidankata) and No. 5 (hikitsukekata) for each assigned region, and about 10 to 20 from the Ashikaga family and Shugo daimyo (Japanese territorial lord as provincial constable) were appointed under tonin (the director).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Naidanshu were divided into No. 3 (naidankata) and No. 5 (hikitsukekata) for each assigned region, and about 10 to 20 members from the Ashikaga family and Shugo daimyo (Japanese territorial lord as provincial constable) were appointed under tonin (the director).
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Naidanshu (council of judges) were divided into No. 3 (naidankata) and No. 5 (hikitsukekata) for each assigned region, and about 10 to 20 members from the Ashikaga family and Shugo daimyo (Japanese territorial lord as provincial constable) were appointed under the director ('tonin').
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: その多くは鎌倉幕府の評定衆・引付衆・奉行人の末裔であり、室町幕府の評定衆や奉行人を兼ねるものもいた。
sen.e: Many of them were descendants of hyojoshu (a member of Council of State), hikitsukeshu, and bugyonin (a magistrate) of the Kamakura bakufu, and some served concurrently as the hyojoshu or bugyonin in the Muromachi bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Many of them were descendants of hyojoshu (a member of the Council of State), hikitsukeshu, and bugyonin (a magistrate) of the Kamakura bakufu, and some served concurrently as hyojoshu or bugyonin in the Muromachi bakufu.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Many of them were descendants of hyojoshu (a member of the Council of State), hikitsukeshu, and bugyonin (a magistrate) of the Kamakura bakufu, and some served concurrently as hyojoshu or bugyonin in the Muromachi bakufu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 彼らは月に6回程度、頭人邸にて内談を開き、管領や政所が受理した鎌倉府支配地域及び九州を除く所領に関する訴訟（年貢・用水訴訟も含む）の処理にあたった。
sen.e: They held meetings at the tonin's house about six times a month and handled trials in connection with shoryo (territory) except for areas controlled by the Kamakura bakufu that were received by kanrei (shogunal deputy) and Mandokoro (Administrative Board), and Kyushu (including cases of nengu (land tax) and water).

They held meetings at the tonin's house about six times a month and handled trials in connection with shoryo (territory) except for areas controlled by the Kamakura bakufu that were received by kanrei (shogunal deputy) and Mandokoro (Administrative Board), and Kyushu (including cases of nengu (land tax) and water).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: They held meetings at the deputy's house about six times a month and handled trials in connection with territory except for areas controlled by the Kamakura bakufu that were administered by kanrei (shogunal deputy) and Mandokoro (Administrative Board), and Kyushu (including cases of nengu (land tax) and water).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 審議は最古参格の奉行人が頭人に次ぐ開闔（次官及び事務局長格）が案件を説明し、籤の抽選順で内談衆が意見を述べていった。
sen.e: In deliberations, the oldest bugyonin participated or Kaigo (post) second to the tonin (vice minister and executive officer) explained the case and then naidanshu stated their opinions in the order decided by drawing lots.

In deliberations, the oldest bugyonin participated, or Kaigo (post), second to the tonin (vice minister and executive officer) explained the case and then naidanshu stated their opinions in the order decided by drawing lots.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: In deliberations, the oldest bugyonin (magistrate) participated, or Kaigo (post), second to the tonin (vice minister and executive officer) explained the case and then council members stated their opinions in the order decided by drawing lots.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 結論は文書化されて征夷大将軍の決裁を得て正式な効力を得た。
sen.e: Decisions were documented and officially took effect with final decisions made by seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians").
Decisions were documented and officially took effect with final decisions made by seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians").
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Decisions were documented and officially took effect with final decisions made by a shogun.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: ただし、14世紀後半頃から将軍が評定衆や内談衆による審議よりも、自らが主宰する御前沙汰などによって問題処理を図るようになったこと、事務・法務職員であった奉行人が奉行衆として直接審議に参加できる資格を得るようになった。
sen.e: However, after the latter half of the 14th century, a shogun began to handle problems in gozensata (formal consultation) headed by himself rather than in deliberations by hyojoshu or naidanshu, and further, bugyonin, persons in charge of office work and judicial affairs, came to obtain qualification to participate directly in deliberations as bugyoshu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, after the latter half of the 14th century, a shogun began to handle problems in gozensata (formal consultation) headed by himself rather than in deliberations by hyojoshu or naidanshu, and further, bugyonin, persons in charge of office work and judicial affairs, came to obtain qualification to participate directly in deliberations as bugyoshu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: However, after the latter half of the 14th century, a shogun began to handle problems in formal consultations headed by himself rather than in deliberations by hyojoshu or naidanshu (councils), and further, bugyonin (magistrates) who were in charge of office work and judicial affairs obtained qualification to participate directly in deliberations as bugyoshu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: このことから形骸化してしまい、15世紀前半には引付方は有名無実と化した。
sen.e: Accordingly, the hikitsukekata lost its substance and was outlived.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Accordingly, the hikitsukekata lost its substance and was outlived.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Accordingly, the hikitsukekata became a mere façade and were no longer appointed from the early fifteenth century.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: なお、足利義晴の頃より内談衆が再び幕政に登場するようになるが、義晴の擁立に参画してその後奉行衆に代わって義晴政権を構成した「殿中申次」などと呼ばれていた将軍側近集団を組織化するとともに、彼らの出自身分や・奉行衆・奉公衆などの職制の枠に捉われない新たな格式・待遇を与えるためであったと考えられている。
sen.e: Incidentally, naidanshu appeared again in the shogunate government headed by Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, which was directed to organizing close advisers of the shogun (who were called the "denchu moshitsugi") who participated in putting up of Yoshiharu and later constituted the Yoshiharu government in place of bugyoshu, while conferring new classes and benefits on the naidanshu irrespective of origins and ranks, or positions such as bugyoshu or hokoshu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Incidentally, naidanshu appeared again in the shogunate government headed by Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, which was directed to organizing close advisers of the shogun (who were called the "denchu moshitsugi") who participated in putting up Yoshiharu and later constituted the Yoshiharu government in place of bugyoshu, while conferring new classes and benefits on the naidanshu, irrespective of origins and ranks, or positions such as bugyoshu or hokoshu.
sen.cmt: slight modification
sen.e: Incidentally, naidanshu (councils) appeared again in the shogunate government headed by Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA, which placed close advisers of the shogun; who supported Yoshiharu and later constituted the Yoshiharu government, in place of bugyoshu, while conferring new classes and benefits on the naidanshu (council members), irrespective of origin and rank, or positions such as bugyoshu (magistrate) or hokoshu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: これは引付方が復活したのではない。
sen.e: Therefore, this does not mean that hikitsukekata was simply brought back.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, this does not mean that hikitsukekata was simply brought back.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: This does not mean the revival of hikitsukekata councils.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。
